programme.title: What Would You Do?
programme.desc: Using hidden cameras, host John Quiñones observes and comments on how ordinary people behave when they are confronted with dilemmas that require them either to take action or to walk by and mind their own business. Various scenarios are created that force people to make split-second -- and often surprising -- decisions, and variations of the situation (such as changing the genders, races or clothing of the people involved) are often featured to see if different reactions are elicited. Examples of situations on the show include a waitress being harassed by her boss, and a drunken valet trying to park cars.

Award-winning program anchored by David Muir, featuring unforgettable, character-driven true crime mysteries, exclusive newsmaker interviews, hard-hitting investigative reports and in-depth coverage of high profile stories.

programme.title: Today
programme.desc: A daily live broadcast provides current domestic and international news, weather reports and interviews with newsmakers from the worlds of politics, business, media, entertainment and sports. programme.title: FRIDAY NIGHT POKER
programme.desc: Watch a replay of the second Friday Night Poker cash game! Bryn Kenney, Lauren Roberts, Jamie Kerstetter, Alan Richardson, Ken Kohl, and Tia Kajah headline an entertaining and action-packed $5/$10 cash game. Jeff Platt, Brent Hanks, and Amanda Leatherman call the action and Daniel Negreanu makes a guest appearance!

programme.title: wsop-2024-be-ev-55-250k-nlh-shr-day2
programme.desc: Watch Day 2 of Event #55: $250,000 Super High Roller from the 2024 World Series of Poker.

programme.title: wsop-2024-be-ev-55-250k-nlh-shr-day3
programme.desc: Watch the final table of Event #55: $250,000 Super High Roller from the 2024 World Series of Poker.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: Nearly 800 rebuys would take this field size to 1,334 and a prize pool of over $1.26 million. The final table would be stacked with tournament veterans led by Daniel Negreanu, John Juanda, Mike Matusow, Lee Markholt, Paul Phillips, and Ram Vaswani as all eyes were on the $365,900 first-place prize.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: The 831-entrant field created a $1.14 million prize pool in the first $1,500 No-Limit Hold'em event of the 2004 WSOP. Poker author Blair Rodman, and tournament regulars Joe Awada, Scott Epstein, and Kent Washington held seats at the final table, along with "The Crew" member Scott Fischman as the $300,000 first-place prize was up for grabs.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: The biggest No-Limit Hold'em buy-in of the 2004 WSOP outside of the Main Event would attract 254 entrants and create a prize pool of $1,193,800. Barry Greenstein and Dewey Tomko fell short of reaching the final table, as WSOP veterans James Sousa and Paul "Eskimo" Clark headlined the final table ahead of Lee Watkinson, Thomas Keller, Martin de Knijff, and Young Phan as they chased the $382,020 first-place prize.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: The $1,000 Ladies Event attracted 201 entrants and would see the final table headlined by Karina Jett and Susie Isaacs as nine lucky ladies look to capture the WSOP bracelet and $58,530 first-place prize.

programme.title: Poker After Dark Holidays with Hellmuth Day 1
programme.desc: The first of three festive Poker After Dark nights headlined by Phil Hellmuth featured jolly $10000 Sit & Go! Rewatch the full show as Hellmuth took on Maria Ho Antonio Esfandiari Mike Matusow Dan Shak and Randall Emmett.

programme.title: Poker After Dark Holidays with Hellmuth Day 2
programme.desc: The festivities continue on Holidays with Hellmuth as Phil takes on all comers in this $100/$200 cash game. Rewatch the whole show now as he goes up against Dan Shak Brian Potashnik David 'Doc' Sands Avi Freedman and Rick Thompson.

programme.title: Poker Masters 2021 Episode 1
programme.desc: The 2021 Poker Masters is underway with Event #1 seeing seven players return and David Peters in control as the chip leader. Peters sits ahead of Brock Wilson, Shannon Shorr, Jonathan Jaffe, Dylan DeStefano, John Riordan, and Ben Yu as they play for the $205,000 first-place prize.

programme.title: Poker Masters
programme.desc: Sean Perry leads the Event #2 final table while John Riordan returns to sit at his second final table of the series. Also in contention are Jeremy Ausmus, Jake Schindler, Sam Soverel, and Daniel Negreanu as the final six play for the $206,400 first-place prize.

programme.title: Poker Masters
programme.desc: The game changes to Pot-Limit Omaha at the 2021 Poker Masters with Matthew Wantman holding the lead. Chris Brewer, Jake Daniels, Adam Hendrix, Brent Roberts, and Jake Schindler are all in the mix for the $186,300 first-place prize.

programme.title: Poker After Dark
programme.desc: Take an intimate look at one table as it develops over a week of play. The world's best players come together to play a single-table tournament or cash game as your favorite players look to beat the best on Poker After Dark.

programme.desc: Take an intimate look at one table as it develops over a week of play. The world's best players come together to play a single-table tournament or cash game as your favorite players look to beat the best on Poker After Dark.

programme.title: Jeff Dunham: Spark of Insanity
programme.desc: Jeff and his felt friends Walter, Melvin the Superhero Guy, Peanut, and others share their latest and greatest thoughts about our times.

programme.title: Jeff Dunham: Unhinged in Hollywood
programme.desc: Previously unseen stand-up comedy by Jeff Dunham; sketches that include popular characters; Brad Paisley performs; special appearances by comic Chris Parnell and former UFC champion Chuck Liddell.

programme.title: Frances Dilorinzo: The Problem Solver
programme.desc: Frances delivers physical humor with every silly bone in her body.

programme.title: Andrew Santino: Homefield Advantage
programme.desc: The comedian Andrew Santino goes home to Chicago for a comedy special, riffing on topics like bachelorette parties, severe acne, and his childhood.

programme.title: Bob Smiley: Tartar Terrorist
programme.desc: The clean comedian discusses his experiences in Arkansas, why he won’t make fun of the Clintons, and his weird moments at the airport.

programme.title: Bob Smiley: You're Just Hungry
programme.desc: The fast-talking comedian discusses touring with a Christian group, laughter being the best medicine, and having a last name TSA agents love.

programme.title: Jesus Trejo: Stay at Home Son
programme.desc: First-generation Mexican-American comic Jesus Trejo is here with jokes and riffs about growing up in L.A. County and other hilarious facts of life.

programme.title: Jim Breuer: Let's Clear the Air
programme.desc: The SNL alum, radio host, and film actor clears the air at his live event, chronicling his transformation from oddball child to ultimate family man.

programme.title: Jim Breuer: And Laughter For All
programme.desc: Marriage and parenthood won't keep die-hard metalhead comedian Jim Breuer from losing his manic sense of humor in this hilarious live show.

programme.title: Kathleen Madigan: Madigan Again
programme.desc: Her Irish Catholic Midwest family, pills in her mom’s purse, touring Afghanistan, an unparalleled love of John Denver…are all fodder for this special.

programme.title: Kim McVicar: Female Comedian
programme.desc: Canadian comedian Kim McVicar explains why your cell phone is more important to you than your kids, how Tik Tok ruined clubbing, and more.

programme.title: Kim McVicar: Tap Dancing on My Mother's Grave
programme.desc: The comedian and former backup dancer riffs about how bad she sucks in bed, advanced-age sex workers and, naturally, her mother’s practice funeral.

programme.title: Rachel Scanlon: Gay Fantasy
programme.desc: Comedian Rachel Scanlon unpacks her life as a soft butch lesbian, from hot tub trauma with her midwestern family to fantasies about her gym teacher.

programme.title: Tom Papa: Freaked Out
programme.desc: The famously upbeat comedian delivers a stand-up performance that includes his observations on the perils of raising daughters and much more.

programme.title: Tom Papa: Live in New York City
programme.desc: With a shiny happy exterior, an offbeat, demented interior and direction from Rob Zombie, Tom Papa’s “Live In New York City” attacks our hilarious attempts at happiness as life piles up around us. He jokes about becoming a parent, family pets, and boundaries for technology.

programme.title: Marc Maron: Thinky Pain
programme.desc: The hilarious podcaster and comedian takes stock of his own neuroses and self-loathing while providing brilliant insights on life.

programme.title: Maria Bamford: The Special Special Special
programme.desc: The comic performs for an audience consisting of only her parents.

programme.title: D.L. Hughley: Clear
programme.desc: Comedian D.L. Hughley comments on current political events and hot topics, from marijuana legalization to the advantages of intrusive white neighbors.

programme.title: D.L. Hughley: Reset
programme.desc: Notable standup comedian D.L. Hughley skewers current political events, his own family issues, and more in this hilarious standup special.

programme.title: Ilana Glazer: The Planet Is Burning
programme.desc: “Broad City” star Ilana Glazer steps up in her first standup comedy set, done in her own raucous style as she takes on Nazis, diva cups, and stoners.

programme.title: Whitney Cummings: Money Shot
programme.desc: Comedy Central roast veteran Whitney Cummings gets the stage to herself in this debut special, which finds the young comedian riffing on a wide range of topics, chiefly the differences between men and women and how both behave in relationships.

programme.title: Iliza Shlesinger: War Paint
programme.desc: Iliza Shlesinger performs her first stand-up special in her hometown of Dallas, Texas.

programme.title: Chris Porter: A Man From Kansas
programme.desc: Kansas-based comedian Chris Porter’s comedy set about men’s very limited emotions, people who think the Earth is flat, and hipsters ruining food.

programme.title: Chris Porter: Ugly & Angry
programme.desc: Last Coming Standing alum, Chris Porter, gives his look on drugs, growing old, women’s fashion, and his love for Taco Bell.

programme.title: Even More Funny Women of a Certain Age
programme.desc: Golden Globe winner Teri Hatcher joins the stage with some of the funniest women in comedy for one night of over-the-top, uninhibited standup.

programme.title: Jill-Michele Meleán: White/Latina
programme.desc: The half-Bolivian, half-Irish comic talks about navigating vastly different cultural identities while creating her own brand of funny.

programme.title: Danny Johnson: The Chusky Life
programme.desc: In this hilarious and clean stand-up special, Danny Johnson recounts fast food horror stories and shares the three rules for living the chusky life.

programme.title: Finesse Mitchell: The Spirit Told Me to Tell You
programme.desc: The Saturday Night Live alum discusses acclimating to the Los Angeles attitude, night clubs, and how he keeps his marriage healthy.

programme.title: Andy Kindler: I Wish I Was Bitter
programme.desc: With good natured rage, comedian and professional trouble maker Andy Kindler ridicules popular culture, show business, and himself in this intimate stand-up comedy performance.

programme.title: Colin Quinn: Unconstitutional
programme.desc: Comedian Colin Quinn analyzes the constitutional history of the United States.

programme.title: Dennis Miller: America 180°
programme.desc: Dennis Miller muses on life in America during Obama's second term and shares his views on healthcare, getting old, and where the country is headed.

programme.title: Dennis Miller: Fake News, Real Jokes
programme.desc: The king of dry wit is back to take down the current political and social climate — from selfies to airline travel to Donald Trump and the media.

programme.title: Mark Christopher Lawrence: Clean Outta Compton
programme.desc: Character actor, stand-up comedian, and voice-over artist Mark Christopher Lawrence brings his comedy to the Dry Bar stage.

programme.title: Shayne Smith: Alligator Boys
programme.desc: This comic delivers wild stories about everything, from a failed robbery, to a wrestling match in the NYC subway, and even about saving a dog’s life.

programme.title: The Sklar Brothers: What Are We Talking About
programme.desc: The Sklar Brothers' bring their A-game to Madison WI with their energetic new comedy special, What Are We Talking About. Watch the former zygote sharing duo duke it out over sports, mullets, and airportæetiquette,æinvoking their power house humor worthy of the hall of fame.

programme.title: Tommy Davidson: Takin' It To D.C.
programme.desc: Whether he's talking about sex, the national anthem, cockroaches or impersonating Michael Jackson, the triple threat is sure to make you laugh.

programme.title: Tommy Davidson: Illin' In Philly
programme.desc: This is Tommy Davidson, from "In Living Color", at his funniest! Check out this classic stand-up special and remember the 90s!

programme.title: Tom Green Live!
programme.desc: MTV's prankster Tom Green brings his outrageous energy and irreverent wit from "The Tom Green Show" to the stage in his first stand-up special.

programme.title: Jeff Dunham: Achmed Saves America
programme.desc: The world's most incompetent terrorist finds himself whisked away from his homeland and taken to Americaville, USA.

programme.title: Jeff Dunham: I'm With Cupid
programme.desc: Ventriloquist and stand-up comedian Jeff Dunham performs an all-Valentine's Day-themed special.

programme.title: Jeff Dunham: Arguing With Myself

programme.title: The F Word
programme.desc: S03:E06 - The F Word

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc:
In tonight's final programme Gordon returns to Momma Cherri's Soul Food Shack, an intimate forty-seater in Brighton where he oversaw one of the most spectacular changes of fortune at a single venue. Owner CHARITA JONES was producing a menu of irresistible unique classics from the Deep South, but at the same facing financial disaster. The punters were missing, and so was her business acumen. But Gordon succeeded in shutting her out of the kitchen, getting the chef back on the boil and putting the soul back into the business.
Today Charita is fully-booked round the clock and bursting out of the Soul Shack to take on the 110-seater Momma Cherri's Big House. But expansion brings a different set of challenges, and she's still struggling to control her staff and manage her success. Has she got what it takes to make the next step up, or will she be forced to rethink her grand plans?

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: In tonight's penultimate programme Gordon returns to La Riviera - now renamed Abstract - a fine dining restaurant in Inverness. Owned by multi-millionaire Barry Larson and costing ~£8000 a week to run, the place boasted top French chef Loic Lefebvre and an impeccably-trained kitchen staff, all of them on a mission to bring sophisticated French cooking to the home of the haggis. But the locals weren't biting and the restaurant was empty most nights. Gordon's recipe for survival forced them to tone down their act and demystify the menu to get the punters in. Today the restaurant's return to form has led to plans for expansion. Loic is still there, and now he's been promoted to Executive Chef he will oversee any new ventures. But can he continue to resist a return to French frills, and has he managed to pull off his own personal ambition, a Michelin star?

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: Tonight, for the first time ever on Kitchen Nightmares, Gordon takes on a nightmare restaurant abroad. La Parra de Burriana is an ex-pat restaurant in Nerja on Spain's Costa del Sol. Nestling among the cafes lining the seafront offering all-day English breakfast and chips, La Parra is the brainchild of twenty-six-year-old ex-nightclub manager Laurence. He set himself up in business eighteen months ago with a loan from his dad and, although he's not an experienced chef, mans the kitchen on his own, determined to offer something better than chips to his largely British clientele.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: In tonight's second programme Gordon tackles a pub for the first time, getting to grips with The Fenwick Arms in rural Lancashire. The pub is run by landlord Brian who, after thirty years in the business and a quadruple heart-bypass, still puts in 120 hours a week and insists on laying down the law in the kitchen. Despite their best endeavours Brian and his partner Elaine are ~£250k in debt, losing ~1500 a week and facing bankruptcy within three months unless there's a drastic reversal in their fortunes.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty tackles three seasons of gardening when he makes additions to his spring garden, gives advice on how to dry and preserve herbs for winter and plants up a container to give interest from now until spring. Carol celebrates one of the plant successes of an extraordinary summer, the Canna while Frances Tophill tackles a viewer's garden and suggests plants which will perform throughout the winter. Toby Buckland visits a garden in Devon with Japanese influences.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: This time there's plenty to do to prepare for the season to come and Monty Don is clearing out spent crops and mulching his asparagus. Joe Swift's been to visit keen gardeners, Wayne and Geraldine Hemingway, to see how they combine sustainability with their designer-style. Carol Klein's exploring the history of the rose at Coughton Court, one of our best rose gardens and Monty plants a new rose of his own. What happens when you have to downsize and leave your much-loved garden?

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Charge your glasses as Joe Swift visits a `drinkable' allotment in London where much of the produce is grown to make beer, wine and cider. In the first of a five-part series about botany, Carol Klein looks at the capsules of potential that herald the start and end of most plants' lives: seeds.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As autumn gathers momentum, it's time to start putting the garden to bed for winter. Monty Don has some timely advice on what to do. Carol Klein meets a nurseryman in Herefordshire and together they indulge in the beauty of the Japanese maple.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With the clocks going forward this weekend, there's an extra hour of gardening to enjoy. Monty makes the most of this as he begins to sow dahlia seeds for summer flowers, reveals a new project and shows what to plant now in the vegetable garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With Bonfire Night in mind, Monty Don turns his attention to the firecracker colours of spring when he begins to tidy up his herbaceous plants to make room to plant tulip bulbs. As well as recommending varieties for an early display, he also shows what to plant now under the shade of trees for colour next year.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Frances Tophill and the team continue to celebrate the joy that the gardening year brings; Rachel de Thame visits Anglesey Abbey; Arit Anderson discovers how rewilding can increase biodiversity.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty welcomes spring at Longmeadow with plenty of changes in the garden to share. As well as getting on with some essential pruning, he lifts and divides perennials, starts sowing chillies and begins growing this year's vegetables.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Adam Frost demonstrates how to build a rose arch, mulches his beds and plants a blackcurrant to train up a fence. Frances Tophill visits RHS Wisley in Surrey to witness the seasonal colour that heathers can provide in the winter months.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: After an extraordinary season, Monty's orchard has a bountiful harvest of apples and he gives advice on how to pick and store them. Frances Tophill makes a final visit to her shared allotment and joins in with the festivities at their annual show. Adam Frost visits the RHS garden Wisley where he meets the Curator to discuss the effects of summer. Nick Bailey investigates knotweed, one of the most pernicious weeds in the UK, Arit Anderson provides inspiration for colourful late season containers.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: In the second of her films about botany, Carol Klein goes underground to unravel the mysteries of roots and why they are so important to the health of our plants. Joe Swift meets fashion icon, Dame Zandra Rhodes, to explore how the flowers she likes to grow have influenced her designs over the years.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty has tips and ideas for planting up garden pots to provide a focal point over the winter months, Rachel visits the tulips of Keukenhof, Joe visits Esther Rantzen's much-loved garden, and Carol visits Glebe Cottage.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty welcomes spring at Longmeadow with plenty of changes in the garden to share. As well as getting on with some essential pruning, he lifts and divides perennials, starts sowing chillies and begins growing this year's vegetables.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As the winter draws to a close, work in the garden starts to step up gear. With the flowers and fruits of summer in mind, Monty Don gets going by planting pots of summer bulbs for colour and scent, passing on his secrets of success by using a variety of planting techniques. He also reveals plans for reinvigorating the area in his garden where perennials are planted. Plus, Carol Klein visits Glendurgan Garden in Cornwall.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With Halloween just round the corner, Monty Don is harvesting his pumpkins and showing how to store them for roasts, soups and stews in the coming months. Joe Swift visits a high end garden in West London to get some tips on how clever landscaping and the use of lighting can turn a small space into an outdoor room which can be used all year round.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don is back at the helm, but this time in the garden at his own Herefordshire home - a place that he has lovingly nurtured for the last 20 years. With winter receding, Monty, Carol Klein, Joe Swift and Rachel de Thame are preparing for spring. As well as showing us round his garden, Monty lifts and divides snowdrops and sows beetroot and plants onions. Monty also prunes his apple trees and trims his shrub roses.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty gives advice on the plants that need winter protection and thinks ahead to colourful spring bouquets. The glory of summer may be over in most gardens, but Carol goes to Worcestershire in search of some autumn colour.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty and the team focus their attention on the loss of wildflower habitats in the UK and the part that gardeners can play in averting the resulting loss of wildlife. Adam Frost is in Lincolnshire to find out how crucial meadows are to supporting an ecosystem.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don prepares for his spring display and tackles slippery paths, Carol Klein visits a collection of Michaelmas daisies and we visit a veg grower with a show-stopping Halloween pumpkin.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: In the cottage garden, Monty is moving a rose which has outgrown its space and in the vegetable garden he gives advice on what to plant now for spring. He also finds out more about the mysterious world of earthworms and discovers why they are vital for the garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don takes some practical steps to protect tender plants as the first frosts of the year begin to bite. He also starts preparing for next spring, planting tulips, pansies and apple trees and sharing his advice on training step-over apples and planting out wallflowers from seed. Meanwhile, Carol Klein is at Glebe Cottage demonstrating how to grow plants from cuttings.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don prepares the flowering borders for winter and makes a bonfire, Carol celebrates our berry-laden hedgerows, and Rachel visits Julian Clary in his garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: In the last programme of the current series, Monty Don takes stock of his year at Longmeadow. We visit RHS Wisley to learn why autumn leaves are such a precious commodity for our gardens, and in the final instalment of her botany series, Carol Klein celebrates the glorious displays put on by flowering plants to attract pollinators.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: We find out how Rachel de Thame got on over the past year as she attempted to grow her own cut flowers, and if you're still in a quandary about what to grow in your winter pots this year, Monty Don may well have the answer.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At Longmeadow, Monty shows how to prune spring-flowering roses and makes successional sowings of vegetables to ensure continuous crops. Adam Frost gives tips on helping plants cope with drought conditions and shows how to save precious water.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At Longmeadow, Monty gives tips on how to keep the garden looking good as well as how to maintain the vegetable plot for continuous crops. From her garden in Devon, Carol Klein gives a comprehensive and seasonal guide to getting plants for free and this time she turns her attention to popular climbers like honeysuckle and clematis.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At Longmeadow Monty checks the progress of the potatoes he planted earlier in the year and recommends plants for dry shade under trees.We travel to Somerset to get water saving tips from a water scientist who uses a variety of techniques to save as much water as possible in her own garden and we meet a gardener who has filled his home with over one thousand houseplants.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Adam Frost is in his garden, bringing viewers up to date on how it has been developing, as well as giving advice on growing hydrangeas. Toby Buckland shares his tips on dealing with damaged shrubs, tree pruning and transplanting perennials.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty gives more advice on tomato-growing, Nick Bailey travels to South Africa in search of the cousins of the Crocosmia, and Advolly Richmond looks at the Victorian trend of garden theme parks.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: It's the Easter weekend, which means extra time to get out and enjoy the garden. At Longmeadow, Monty plants out sweet peas for summer colour, gives advice on what to use for mulching borders and has plenty of ideas for jobs to get on with this long weekend. Carol Klein is at RHS Rosemoor to revel in the floral spring sensations that epitomise the season. In Scotland, JJ Chalmers explains how important his local park was in helping both his physical and mental rehabilitation.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With Bonfire Night in mind, Monty Don turns his attention to the firecracker colours of spring when he begins to tidy up his herbaceous plants to make room to plant tulip bulbs. As well as recommending varieties for an early display, he also shows what to plant now under the shade of trees for colour next year.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty tackles three seasons of gardening when he makes additions to his spring garden, gives advice on how to dry and preserve herbs for winter and plants up a container to give interest from now until spring. Carol celebrates one of the plant successes of an extraordinary summer, the Canna while Frances Tophill tackles a viewer's garden and suggests plants which will perform throughout the winter. Toby Buckland visits a garden in Devon with Japanese influences.

programme.title: Monty Don's American Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels from Missouri to Chicago and then across to New York and Philadelphia. He begins his journey in a prairie, the original American flowering wilderness. Much of the prairie has disappeared but he meets a couple who have revived the tradition and enjoy showing it to him in full bloom.

programme.title: Monty Don's American Gardens
programme.desc: Monty goes South to explore gardens of early independent America and learns how the history of this part of the country is still very much evident in the places and people he meets. He visits the famous garden where President Thomas Jefferson, one of America's founding fathers, enjoyed spending his time seeking out seeds and plants for his thousand foot vegetable garden.

programme.title: Monty Don's American Gardens
programme.desc: Monty explores the extraordinary scenery of the west coast of America. He begins his journey in Arizona where he learns about cacti and marvels at the sight of them in the desert and in private gardens where they have replaced traditional plants and lawns.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels to Europe and explores the influence of the Venetians on gardening. To begin with, he explores Venice on one of the city's famous barges, stepping out to visit green spaces large and small that are often hidden from view behind high walls.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins in the city of Trieste, close to Italy's border with Croatia, to visit a public garden first created by an obsessive royal plantsman more than 150 years ago, which is now being carefully restored. He then heads down the Adriatic coast through Croatia to pick up the trail that the Venetians followed, ending his journey on the beautiful island of Lopud, near Dubrovnik.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins the last leg of his journey in Corfu, a Greek island with strong Venetian links, including olive trees planted by them that are still grown today. Here, Monty visits a spectacular garden made by an Englishman with Greek connections.

programme.title: Monty Don's Paradise Gardens
programme.desc: In Morocco, Monty discovers the wide variety of paradise gardens. He begins just outside the city of Marrakesh in an enormous royal walled meadow, The Agdal. From there he moves to the heart of the town where he comes upon a tiny garden where huge banana plants jostle with palms to create a secret paradise garden, a shelter from the busy world outside. And in another part of the city a rundown old palace has been turned into a stunning contemporary garden with a twist.

programme.title: Monty Don's Paradise Gardens
programme.desc: In Turkey Monty is dazzled by an extraordinary display of the Ottoman Empire's favourite flower, the tulip, and learns of its sacred significance. Travelling further East to India he encounters a new type of spirituality in the tomb gardens of the Mughal Empire. Stunning mausoleums were set in vast gardens as places where an earthly king could enter a divine paradise.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don conducts a personal grand tour around Italy's magnificent gardens from the luxurious retreats of the moneyed north to the lavish hideaways of the romantic south. In this episode, he's in and around Rome, a powerbase of emperors and popes, to explore gardens that are among some of the most extravagant and flamboyant ever created in history.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don is on a grand tour around Italy, this time visiting gardens both in Florence and around the sun-scorched Tuscan countryside. Monty discovers how, like a piece of sculpture, renaissance gardens were created as works of art, and how a group of Edwardian ex-pats mistakenly reinforced the idea that formal Italian gardens were flowerless.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don continues his grand garden tour of Italy. This time he is in Naples to visit some of the most sublime, romantic retreats in southern Italy. After all the formality of the green gardens around Rome and Florence, Monty seeks out idyllic horticultural gems set against the dramatic scenery of the Amalfi Coast to discover why, in the south, gardens are informal and, above all, filled with flowers.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don concludes his garden tour of Italy in the wealthy north where, in the Veneto and Lucca, extravagant pleasure gardens were created for flirtation and fun. In the Lakes, Monty meets up with the garden society, the Grandi Giardini Italiani, to peer over the fence at luxurious creations of the rich and famous. The journey ends on Lake Maggiore to see the most theatrical horticultural gem of Italy.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty tackles three seasons of gardening when he makes additions to his spring garden, gives advice on how to dry and preserve herbs for winter and plants up a container to give interest from now until spring. Carol celebrates one of the plant successes of an extraordinary summer, the Canna while Frances Tophill tackles a viewer's garden and suggests plants which will perform throughout the winter. Toby Buckland visits a garden in Devon with Japanese influences.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty harvests his favourite winter veg, Joe Swift discovers AJ Odudu's passion for houseplants, and Sue Kent and Toby Buckland take an inspirational trip to Piet Oudolf's garden in Somerset.

programme.title: Hard Truths of Conservation
programme.desc: Establishing themselves just after the last Ice Age, the blacktail of Vancouver Island offers an important genetic population isolated from the mainland. To explore the local relationship with the species, its harvesting, conservation and history, Dan Cabela travels to the island.

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: Kyle Green and Jeff Hutchinson head to Maryland to bow-fish for an invasive, toothy fish called the snakehead. They learn how this fish, a native of Asia, made its way to the United States. They also learn from the locals, despite its appearance, it is one tasty fish.

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: Kyle Green meets up with his friends at the National Wild Turkey Federation to dive into turkey conservation, and hunt the largest subspecies of wild turkey. Kyle finishes off this episode with his most favorite wild game recipe, boneless wild turkey wings.

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: Kyle and Jeff team up with their friends from Boss Shotshells in South Dakota for a high-energy upland hunt, pursuing wild pheasants with the help of skilled hunting dogs. The adventure takes a quirky turn with a visit to the iconic Corn Palace.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: PCB’s white sand beaches are jam-packed with visitors soaking up sunand surf while Justin and Meredith chase schools of migrating tarponjust offshore. How often do those two worlds collide?

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: While releasing a defeated tarpon healthy after an epic battle is the ultimate victory, everything else is measured in heartbreak and degrees of failure. For Justin, putting Ethan on his first silver king requires patience and a tasty diversion by a local chef.

programme.title: Deer and Deer Hunting
programme.desc: We explore the sophisticated world of the whitetail deer's senses, exploring how these remarkable creatures have evolved to pattern hunters through their keen sense of smell and heightened sensory awareness.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Overview: Across the country, deer season to many Americans is a rite of passage. For generations, Winchester has been the trusted ammunition choice for hunters…and it’s been a decade since the game-changing Deer Season XP whitetail line was introduced. In this episode, we’ll celebrate the many successes by Team Winchester hunters in the field during whitetail and mule deer firearm seasons across the United States. GUESTS: Melissa Bachman (Team Winchester) Mark Drury (Team Winchester) Nikki Boxler (Team Winchester) Chris Keefer (Team Winchester) Casey Keefer (Team Winchester) Jason Gilbertson (Team Winchester)

programme.title: TRP
programme.desc: Today we’re having a conversation with Zeb Hogan, the author, biologist, and television host known for his show "Monster Fish." In this episode, Hogan shares his experiences with the show, his upcoming book "Chasing Giants: In Search of the World's Largest Freshwater Fish," and his insights into the world of freshwater biology. Hogan's show "Monster Fish" takes viewers on a journey around the globe to explore the largest and most elusive freshwater fish in the world. programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: Kyle Green and Jeff Hutchinson head to Maryland to bow-fish for an invasive, toothy fish called the snakehead. They learn how this fish, a native of Asia, made its way to the United States. They also learn from the locals, despite its appearance, it is one tasty fish.

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Overview: Across the country, deer season to many Americans is a rite of passage. For generations, Winchester has been the trusted ammunition choice for hunters…and it’s been a decade since the game-changing Deer Season XP whitetail line was introduced. In this episode, we’ll celebrate the many successes by Team Winchester hunters in the field during whitetail and mule deer firearm seasons across the United States. GUESTS: Melissa Bachman (Team Winchester) Mark Drury (Team Winchester) Nikki Boxler (Team Winchester) Chris Keefer (Team Winchester) Casey Keefer (Team Winchester) Jason Gilbertson (Team Winchester)

programme.title: TRP
programme.desc: Today we’re having a conversation with Zeb Hogan, the author, biologist, and television host known for his show "Monster Fish." In this episode, Hogan shares his experiences with the show, his upcoming book "Chasing Giants: In Search of the World's Largest Freshwater Fish," and his insights into the world of freshwater biology. Hogan's show "Monster Fish" takes viewers on a journey around the globe to explore the largest and most elusive freshwater fish in the world. programme.desc: A district attorney reopens the case against the murderer of Medgar Evers.

programme.desc: A jungle man is raised from infancy by apes in this wild adventure.

programme.desc: An apartment superintendent discovers a creature in the complex's pool.

programme.desc: A former professional baseball player must confront past choices.

programme.title: Suspect

programme.title: Home Invasion
programme.desc: A botched robbery turns into a hostage crisis as a gang of armed criminals holds a woman and four children captive while police surround the house.

programme.title: Stealth
programme.desc: Three of the world’s best pilots are partnered with a high-tech pilotless warplane, but soon it becomes clear that the machine has a mind of its own.

programme.title: Rudy
programme.desc: A big-hearted, working class teenager must overcome the odds in order to fulfill his dreams of playing football for Notre Dame.

programme.title: The Karate Kid
programme.desc: A teenager learns wisdom and self-control from an unorthodox karate master. With his new mentor's guidance, the boy faces down his fears.

programme.title: The Karate Kid Part II
programme.desc: After learning that his father is dying, karate master Mr. Miyagi (Noriyuki "Pat" Morita) returns home to Okinawa, bringing his protege, Daniel (Ralph Macchio), with him. In Japan, Miyagi is surprised to discover that his old sweetheart, Yukie (Nobu McCarthy), has remained single. Meanwhile, Daniel is attracted to Yukie's niece, Kumiko (Tamlyn Tomita). But romance must be put on hold while Daniel and Miyagi deal with local bullies and long-harbored grudges.

programme.title: A Knight's Tale
programme.desc: A peasant poses as a knight and enters a medieval jousting tournament in order to escape his humble roots and win the heart of a noble lady.

programme.title: The Last Dragonslayer
programme.desc: After finding that people are hunting the last dragon, an orphaned 15-year-old takes action to save it and the magical world they both inhabit.

programme.title: Crooked House
programme.desc: Based on the novel by Agatha Christie.

programme.title: Blue Thunder
programme.desc: Classic ‘80s action film about a police pilot who learns that the futuristic helicopter he’s testing could cause hellish destruction on U.S. citizens.

programme.title: First Daughter
programme.desc: During a hiking trip, the President's daughter gets kidnapped. Now it is up to Agent McGregor and a river guide to rescue her before it is too late.

programme.title: First Target
programme.desc: A group of deadly assassins targets the US President as he tours a state park aboard a tram, and it's up to Secret Service agent, Alex, to stop them.

programme.title: First Shot
programme.desc: A sniper's bullet has left the President in critical condition. Now a secret service agent must track down the terrorists behind the attack.

programme.title: The Throwaways
programme.desc: After a shrewd hacker is captured by the CIA, he agrees to work with them as long as he gets to pick the members of his ragtag team.

programme.title: Sunset
programme.desc: Bruce Willis and James Garner star as 1920s legends, actor Tom Mix and crimefighter Wyatt Earp, who join forces to solve a Beverly Hills killing.

programme.title: Guess Who's Coming to Dinner
programme.desc: A daughter visits her family to introduce them to her Black fiancé, whose kindness and loving demeanor changes the hearts of her reluctant parents.

programme.title: The Heroes of Telemark
programme.desc: In German-occupied Norway in 1942, a resistance group attempts to sabotage the Nazi's production of essential atomic bomb components.

programme.title: Autumn Leaves
programme.desc: An aging, lonely spinster marries a good-looking younger man only to find that he has a very tormented past and is mentally disturbed.

programme.title: Where Angels Go...Trouble Follows
programme.desc: A bus trip for the girls of St. Francis Academy in Pennsylvania takes a radical detour on its way to an interfaith youth rally in California.

programme.title: Her Husband's Affairs
programme.desc: Advertising executive William Weldon (Franchot Tone) narrowly averts career implosion when his clever wife, Margaret (Lucille Ball), helps him save an important advertising account. But tensions run high in the Weldon household after William's fast-talking employer, J.B. Cruikshank (Edward Everett Horton), invites Margaret to work for him too. The cunning couple must compete with each other to write a campaign for Emil Glinka (Mikhail Rasumny) -- a mad scientist with an alarming new product.

programme.title: Run Wild, Run Free
programme.desc: A mute boy who spends his days roaming the English countryside starts coming out of his shell when he befriends a wild pony and a retired colonel.

programme.title: The Notorious Landlady
programme.desc: After falling for his charming landlady, an American diplomat in London learns that she's suspected of murder and tries to help her clear her name.

programme.title: The Wackiest Ship in the Army
programme.desc: During WW II, Lt. Rip Crandall and his inexperienced and motley crew get assigned to deliver an Australian observer to a Japanese-held island.

programme.title: It Happened One Night
programme.desc: When a brash reporter starts trailing a runaway heiress on her bus trip from Florida to New York for a big scoop, can love be far behind?

programme.title: Guess Who's Coming to Dinner
programme.desc: A daughter visits her family to introduce them to her Black fiancé, whose kindness and loving demeanor changes the hearts of her reluctant parents.

programme.title: From Here to Eternity
programme.desc: A World War II classic about the violence, quarrels, and romantic intrigue affecting a group of soldiers at Pearl Harbor before the tragic attack.

programme.title: The Awful Truth
programme.desc: Jerry (Cary Grant) and Lucy (Irene Dunne) are a married couple who doubt each other's fidelity: Jerry suspects Lucy and her music teacher (Alexander D'Arcy) of spending an evening together, and Lucy is convinced Jerry lied about a business trip. When the jealous pair file for divorce, both rush into new relationships, but quickly realize their love never died. The soon-to-be-divorced husband and wife then both scramble to spoil each other's chances for newfound romance.

programme.title: We Were Strangers
programme.desc: When her brother is murdered, China Valdez (Jennifer Jones) swears revenge on the corrupt Cuban government he had been protesting. She joins the resistance led by Tony (John Garfield), an American with a plan that promises devastating results to their enemies. First they'll kill a government official, then plant a bomb at the funeral, which will wipe out the dead man's associates when it explodes. All they need to do is to dig an underground tunnel from China's house to the cemetery next door.

programme.title: The Lone Wolf and His Lady
programme.desc: When a gem disappears from an exhibition, jewel-thief-turned-reporter Lone Wolf (Ron Randell) is accused.

programme.title: Salome
programme.desc: Salome tries to save John the Baptist from losing his head to the sword of King Herod, reversing the story that she was responsible for his death.

programme.title: Born Yesterday
programme.desc: Brassy blonde moll Billie Dawn (Judy Holliday) hits Washington, D.C., with her unscrupulous millionaire sugar daddy, Harry Brock (Broderick Crawford), and his sleazy lawyer, Jim Devery (Howard St. John), who has been pressuring Harry to marry Billie by pointing out that a wife cannot be forced to testify against her husband. In an effort to make Billie more socially acceptable, Harry hires journalist Paul Verrall (William Holden) to smarten her up -- and sparks soon fly between the pair.

programme.title: Gidget (1959)
programme.desc: Things turn around for a sad-faced teen who can’t measure up to the chesty, bikini babes on the beach when two surfers start paying her attention.

programme.title: Passport to Suez
programme.desc: Master sleuth Lone Wolf (Warren William) outwits Nazi spies for canal plans in Egypt.

programme.title: The Mouse That Roared
programme.desc: When a kerfuffle over fine wine exports upends their tiny nation's economy, the prime minister and grand duchess of Fenwick declare war on the U.S.

programme.title: Tell It to the Judge
programme.desc: Marsha Meredith (Rosalind Russell) has just been offered a position as a federal judge. Much to her dismay, her nomination is challenged on the grounds that her divorce renders her unsuitable for the courtroom. Desperate to win the position, Marsha arranges a fake marriage to Alexander (Gig Young), even though she still has feelings for Peter (Robert Cummings), her ex-husband. Marsha and Alexander -- and Marsha and Peter -- soon find themselves in a series of compromising situations.

programme.title: Gidget Grows Up
programme.desc: When her boyfriend leaves for the Air Force without calling, Gidget heads to New York in the name of world peace and joins the U.N. as a tour guide.

programme.title: Shopworn
programme.desc: After her release from a three-month prison sentence, Kitty Lane becomes an overnight musical sensation and renews her romance with David Livingston.

programme.title: Mr. Deeds Goes to Town
programme.desc: Longfellow Deeds (Gary Cooper), a resident of small-town Vermont, leads a simple life until he inherits a vast fortune from a late uncle. Soon, unscrupulous lawyer John Cedar (Douglas Dumbrille) brings Deeds to New York City, where the unassuming heir is the object of much media attention. When wily reporter Babe Bennett (Jean Arthur) gains the trust and affection of Deeds, she uses her position to publish condescending articles about him -- but are her feelings for him really that shallow?

programme.title: South of Death Valley
programme.desc: The Durango Kid attempts to ease tensions between ranchers and miners over the cause of polluted water.

programme.title: Three Hours to Kill
programme.desc: The inhabitants of a small western community turn on Jim Guthrie (Dana Andrews) when he becomes the prime suspect for a murder he didn't commit. Before getting a chance to prove his innocence, Jim is driven from his home and into the wilderness, where he is left for dead. Despite the danger, he comes back years later, discovering that he's still a wanted man. But a kindhearted local named Chris (Dianne Foster) believes his story, and together they begin a desperate search for the true culprit.

programme.title: The White Squaw
programme.desc: A Swedish settler (David Brian) starts a war when he tries to drive Dakotas off their Wyoming reservation.

programme.title: The Parson and the Outlaw
programme.desc: Billy the Kid (Anthony Dexter) retires from the outlaw life, fakes his own death and adopts the name William Bonney. Soon, William runs into Jack Slade (Sonny Tufts), a gun-toting stranger who is itching for a gunfight. Jack falls in with a group of thugs terrorizing William's town. The Rev. Jericho Jones (Buddy Rogers) exhorts William to defend the townspeople, and, when William's maid, Tonya (Marie Windsor), is beaten by the thugs, he grabs his pistol.

programme.title: Go West, Young Lady
programme.desc: A vicious outlaw called Pecos Pete (Onslow Stevens) has long tormented the peaceful residents of a small frontier town. So these desperate people hire a dedicated new sheriff, Tex Miller (Glenn Ford), to bring this ruffian to justice. But, for all his determination, Tex is tricked by Pete and led into an ambush. Ultimately, it is the wily and brassy transplant Belinda "Bill" Pendergast (Penny Singleton) who uncovers Pete's true identity and plots a way to run him out of town once and for all.

programme.title: 40 Guns to Apache Pass
programme.desc: A cavalry captain (Audie Murphy) rescues settlers and catches a corporal (Kenneth Tobey) selling rifles to Apaches.

programme.title: The Fighting Frontiersman
programme.desc: A Texas Ranger learns that the prospector who found Santa Ana's treasure has been captured by gold thieves.

programme.title: The Bandit of Zhobe
programme.desc: After Maj. Crowley (Norman Wooland) arrests the warrior Kasim Khan (Victor Mature) under suspicion of attacking British troops, Khan escapes. While he is away, a rival warlord, Azhad Khan, dresses his troops as British soldiers and attacks Kasim's village, killing his family. Thinking that the British are behind the attack, Kasim wages war against them. Only Crowley's daughter, Zena (Anne Aubrey), with help from her guard, Stokes (Anthony Newley), sees that Kasim is not the enemy.

programme.title: The Shadow Riders
programme.desc: Two brothers return home after the Civil War to find that their family has been kidnapped by a marauding band of rebel Confederate guerrillas.

programme.title: Jesse James vs. the Daltons
programme.desc: An outcast rumored to be the son of notorious outlaw Jesse James makes contact with the Dalton gang in hopes of learning the truth about his lineage.

programme.title: Cripple Creek
programme.desc: A federal agent (George Montgomery) and two colleagues infiltrate a gang of gold-rush gold smugglers.

programme.title: Traveling Saleswoman
programme.desc: A soapmaker's daughter (Joan Davis) goes to the Wild West, followed by her boyfriend (Andy Devine).

programme.title: The Domino Kid
programme.desc: A Confederate veteran (Rory Calhoun) hunts to kill the five outlaws who ran off his cattle and shot his father.

programme.title: Montana Territory
programme.desc: A cowgirl vigilante (Wanda Hendrix) proves to a deputy (Lon McCallister) that the sheriff (Preston Foster) is an outlaw.

programme.title: A Lawless Street
programme.desc: The honorable Calem Ware (Randolph Scott), marshal of the Wild West boomtown of Medicine Bend, attempts to defuse the simmering tensions in his rapidly growing and increasingly violent town, as a greedy businessman (Warner Anderson) hires a sinister black-gloved gunman (Michael Pate) to take care of his problems with the marshal for good. Meanwhile, a traveling song-and-dance troupe arrives in town, bearing Ware's lost love, Tally (Angela Lansbury), who holds the secret to his violent past.

programme.title: The Violent Men
programme.desc: Former Union soldier John Parrish (Glenn Ford) wants to sell his ranch and start a new life by settling down out east. However, the ruthless tactics of Lew Wilkison (Edward G. Robinson), the scheming businessman interested in his property, make Parrish reconsider the move, especially after one of his ranch hands is murdered. Adding to the increasingly tense conflict is Wilkison's wife, Martha (Barbara Stanwyck), who is cheating on her husband with his brother, Cole (Brian Keith).

programme.title: The Revenge Rider
programme.desc: A cowboy suspects a local cattleman's association is behind the murder of his brother, the sheriff.

programme.title: Last of the Comanches
programme.desc: A cavalry sergeant (Broderick Crawford) leads soldiers, civilians and an Indian (Johnny Stewart) on a desert trek.

programme.title: The Quick Gun
programme.desc: A banished gunfighter (Audie Murphy) returns to his sweetheart (Merry Anders) and helps his sheriff friend (James Best) face outlaws.

programme.title: Seminole Uprising
programme.desc: An Army lieutenant (George Montgomery) is ordered to go after Florida Indians in Texas.

programme.title: Thunderhoof
programme.desc: Two men and a young woman in the Mexican wilderness are intent on tracking down a wild stallion.

programme.desc: A vicious outlaw called Pecos Pete (Onslow Stevens) has long tormented the peaceful residents of a small frontier town. So these desperate people hire a dedicated new sheriff, Tex Miller (Glenn Ford), to bring this ruffian to justice. But, for all his determination, Tex is tricked by Pete and led into an ambush. Ultimately, it is the wily and brassy transplant Belinda "Bill" Pendergast (Penny Singleton) who uncovers Pete's true identity and plots a way to run him out of town once and for all.

programme.title: 40 Guns to Apache Pass
programme.desc: A cavalry captain (Audie Murphy) rescues settlers and catches a corporal (Kenneth Tobey) selling rifles to Apaches.

programme.title: 3:10 to Yuma
programme.desc: Dan Evans (Van Heflin), a drought-plagued Arizona rancher, volunteers to take captured stagecoach robber and murderer Ben Wade (Glenn Ford) from Bisbee to Contention City, where the criminal will be put aboard the 3:10 train to Yuma for his trial. Accompanied only by the town drunk, Alex Potter (Henry Jones), Dan battles Wade's henchman (Richard Jaeckel), the murder victim's revenge-minded brother, and the temptation of the large bribe Wade offers in exchange for his freedom.

programme.title: Gun Fury
programme.desc: California-bound rancher Ben Warren (Rock Hudson) is shot and left for dead when a demented ex-Confederate, Frank Slayton (Phil Carey), kidnaps his Southern bride-to-be (Donna Reed). Revived, Ben sets out to rescue her. Along the way, he picks up Jess Burgess (Leo Gordon), a slighted former member of Slayton's gang, and American Indian local Johash (Pat Hogan), who has his own beef with the outlaws. Together they embark on a perilous chase toward the Mexican border to stop Slayton.

programme.title: She
programme.desc: Explorers uncover a lost kingdom ruled by an immortal queen.

programme.title: The Human Comedy
programme.desc: A small-town telegraph boy deals with growing up during World War II.

programme.title: The Man Who Came to Dinner
programme.desc: After an accident, a literary critic recovers at the home of the family he was visiting, but his unplanned stay turns their lives upside down.

programme.title: Bundle of Joy
programme.desc: A shop girl is mistaken for the mother of a foundling.

programme.title: Tortilla Flat
programme.desc: Inhabitants of a California village strive for the simple pleasures.

programme.title: The Hypnotic Eye
programme.desc: A city is stricken by a wave of horrific self-mutilations.

programme.title: Rocky Mountain
programme.desc: A Confederate troop makes a desperate attempt to build an army in the West.

programme.title: Horror of Dracula
programme.desc: After finding his missing friend undead in Dracula’s crypt, vampire hunter Van Helsing must save his pal’s frail fiancée from the count’s next bite.

programme.title: The Belle of New York
programme.desc: A turn-of-the-century playboy courts a Salvation Army girl.

programme.title: Souls For Sale
programme.desc: In 19th-century Chinatown, adventurer Gilbert De Quincey saves slave girls.

programme.title: The Charge of the Light Brigade
programme.desc: Two brothers love the same woman at a perilous Indian outpost.

programme.title: Battle of the Bulge
programme.desc: A crack Nazi unit holds off the Allies during World War II.

programme.title: Meet Me in St. Louis
programme.desc: Judy Garland's 1944 musical dramatizes turn-of-the-century family life.

programme.title: Ride, Vaquero!
programme.desc: Ranchers in New Mexico have to face Indians and bandits.

programme.title: Hysteria
programme.desc: An American suffering from amnesia after a car accident tries to remember his true identity, but stumbles onto a murder plot in the process.

programme.title: City for Conquest
programme.desc: A driver risks his sight when he boxes to pay for his brother's education.

programme.title: The Treasure of the Sierra Madre
programme.desc: Three prospectors fight off bandits and each other after striking it rich.

programme.title: 55 Days at Peking
programme.desc: An American major leads the defense against Chinese revolutionaries.

programme.title: Executive Action
programme.desc: Wealthy right-wing businessmen plot the assassination of JFK.

programme.title: So Big
programme.desc: A schoolteacher-turned-farmer fights to save the land and her son.

programme.title: The Glass Bottom Boat
programme.desc: A woman writing a scientist's biography is mistaken for a spy.

programme.title: Manpower
programme.desc: Power linemen feud over the love of a sultry nightclub singer.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: When mummified remains are found at Halloween attractions, Brennan and Booth realize that they must find the killer by Halloween or there will be another death.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: The team suspects colleagues when the remains of a young Jeffersonian intern are found in the building's incinerator; Booth poses as Cam's boyfriend and accompanies her on a family get-together.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: When high-school classmates reunite to unearth a time capsule buried 20 years earlier, they find the corpse of an adolescent friend inside; while combing through the victim's life, the team members rehash their own teen years.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: The team investigates the murder of a Navy contractor who secretly lived two lives for decades.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: Pride is given a series of tasks to complete by unknown assailants who are holding Wade and his father hostage.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: Pride and the team hope to take down a secret and lethal group of former intelligence agents and avenge the death of someone close to them.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: While under cover, Gregorio joins a social club for military wives after one of the members is contacted by an ex-boyfriend who is on the FBI's most wanted list.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: NCIS investigates the disappearance of a Navy entomologist after a deadly shooting at a research lab; the team finds that a rare and deadly virus was stolen.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: Pride and the team reunite with conspiracy journalist Oliver Crane after the source for his latest story is murdered; Hannah's former partner, Liam Somers, surprises her and shares a shocking revelation about an old case.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: The team investigates multiple murders tied to a construction company that creates an experimental chemical that strengthens sea walls; evidence from Hannah's previous mission in Oman is used against her.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: After an elusive terrorist with a personal vendetta against Hannah resurfaces, she and her family are placed in protective custody while the team searches for the suspect.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: After apprehending a fugitive, a bounty hunter is murdered; Rachel reveals a secret to Danny that has ramifications; Chin talks to McGarrett about his concerns regarding Adam.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: On the eve of Adam and Kono's wedding, the Five-0 must stop a fanatical patriot who wants to detonate stolen nuclear warheads and place the blame on a terrorist -- resulting in a new war on terror.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: The team investigates a centuries-old pirate story involving buried treasure; Gabriel kidnaps Kono and Adam on the morning after their wedding.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: A bomb squad is attacked and the culprit threatens to detonate hidden explosive devices unless arsonist Jason Sinclair (Randy Couture) is released from prison.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: A scuba diver is killed with a gun that was used in a recent murder; McGarrett gets ready to propose to Catherine.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: A wealthy recluse's corpse is found in a field with almost $1 million in counterfeit bills; Adam is abducted and forced to torture one of Gabriel's men.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: The team questions members of a stunt biker gang when a killer escapes by jumping his motorcycle from roof to roof; the team prepares for Tough Mudder.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: On Halloween, the team tracks a serial killer inspired by an iconic character; a blood bank is raided by an armed gang.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: McGarrett and Lynn's date on a deserted island turns deadly when a mob boss gets involved; a gambler abducts a high-school football star's father in hopes of forcing the athlete to throw a game.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: A charming con man (Kristoffer Polaha) helps Five-0 look for the person who murdered his partner; a police inspector from San Francisco (Julie Benz) works with Chin on an investigation involving the murders of five arms dealers.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: When a college professor is killed, Five-0 goes back to school with Danny, who is posing as the professor's replacement.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: When a promising local boxer's brother is murdered, the prime suspect is an outspoken opponent -- the reigning champion.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: Danny and McGarrett try to solve their partnership issues with a couples retreat in Maui; Kamekona's past comes back to haunt him.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: A special personal mission sends McGarrett's Aunt Deb (Carol Burnett) to Oahu; unstable Japanese WWII bombs hidden on the island are stolen.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: Grover goes to Chicago to get a confession from Clay Maxwell; Chin and Kono are held at gunpoint by people who don't know they are cops.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: A double homicide occurs that involves infidelity; McGarrett and the team share disastrous Valentine's Day experiences.

programme.title: Scorpion
programme.desc: The members of Team Scorpion are asked to help NASA with a top-secret rocket launch, but they must sabotage their own mission when Walter's date finds a bomb strapped to her chest.

programme.title: Scorpion
programme.desc: When a powerful earthquake hits Los Angeles, Team Scorpion must prevent a pinched gas line from causing a massive explosion.

programme.title: Scorpion
programme.desc: Team Scorpion must stop an influx of drugs that are being smuggled into the country via drones; an ultimatum is issued.

programme.title: Scorpion
programme.desc: Sylvester wins big on "The Price Is Right"; the team must infiltrate a high-end car smuggling operation that is preparing to ship weapons to South America.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: When Pride is spotted tracking one of Mayor Hamilton's accomplices on a crowded street, the suspect opens fire, putting innocent lives at risk before disappearing.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: Unable to trust anyone in New Orleans, the NCIS team calls in FBI Assistant Director Isler to help expose and stop Mayor Hamilton's sinister scheme.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: While Pride remains on probation after his rogue takedown of the corrupt Mayor Hamilton, his team is closely monitored by a strict supervisor; the team must secretly investigate after the FBI takes the lead on a case involving stolen nuclear waste.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: An erratic whistleblower who calls Pride her mentor kidnaps him to help her locate a serial killer targeting young women in the Gulf of Mexico.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: The team joins forces with FBI Director Isler after a Russian operative with intelligence on sleeper agents disappears; Tammy partners with former sleeper agent Eva Azarova to assist in the disappearance.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: The team investigates the copycat murder of an unsolved case from 150 years ago that spawned a legendary ghost story; Gregorio is spooked when the case is connected to a recent séance and a local medium.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: Sebastian is placed on administrative leave after being questioned by the FBI about a foot chase; Pride and the team attempt to clear Sebastian's name.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: The murder of a petty officer leads the team to a woman who is targeting men with high security clearance; Lasalle's father arrives to discuss the family business.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: The team investigates after a clinical trial in which brain implants are put into veterans is hacked; Patton must work alongside his ex-wife, who spearheads the project.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: Wade's son asks Pride for help after being attacked and discovering his girlfriend is missing; Pride must meet with a therapist to discuss his process for solving cases.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: Pride starts to doubt evidence suggesting homeless kids murdered a petty officer.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: Rita Deveraux tells Pride that Douglas Hamilton is about to make a deal to get out of prison; Pride and the team re-investigate the Clearwater case in hopes of spoiling his plans.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: After a deadly armed robbery and high-speed chase is linked to an undercover ATF operation, Percy reconnects with her former ATF partner.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: During a regatta, the body of Rowing Club chairman Guy Sweetman is found bludgeoned and drowned. Bachelor Sweetman was prolifically promiscuous and jealousy would seem to be the motive.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby and Scott follow a trail of dead people involved in the collecting of rare orchids.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A four-member syndicate owns a racehorse that two of them are desperate to sell and two of them are determined to keep. When one of them is murdered, Barnaby is on the case.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: DCI Barnaby and Sgt. Scott investigate the death of John Ransom in the village of Midsomer Mere. He had just been ejected from a pub for fighting but the post mortem shows a series of burn marks on his skull indicating he may have been subject to electric shock.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Troubled solicitor Nick Turner falls from the roof of his home, is this suicide disguised as murder?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When a corporate giant tries to acquire a small but respected relish factory owned and run by a dysfunctional family, a naked body is found in the warehouse.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Deaths follow the discovery of a valuable musical manuscript sold cheaply at an auction.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The demise of the Shirewell patriarch sparks a vicious inheritance dispute when eldest son Lucian announces plans to break up an estate that's been in his family for centuries.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When the author of a book that sparked a nationwide treasure hunt is found dead, Barnaby and Winter must unravel the cryptic clues to find the killer among a group of dedicated seekers.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: After a pet detective turns up dead inside the kennel of a dog he was searching for, Barnaby and Winter are drawn into the world of dognapping, cat seduction, and animal investigation.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Sleepy Goodman's Land is known as the Greenest Village in Midsomer. But when the entire village is bought by a Texas oilman, a string of grisly murders ensues.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: It's Christmas and new detective Charlie Nelson moves into Midsomer. He's thrown straight into an intriguing mystery in the village of Morton Shallows. A man is fatally stabbed with an antique sword during a ghost-hunting party at a "haunted" manor house. Can Barnaby and Nelson find a more earthly motive behind the murder and trap the killer?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A series of murders in Midsomer St Claire seem to be inspired by macabre images on a medieval fresco recently discovered in the church crypt. As the village prepares for storms and flooding it appears that someone is using ancient torture methods to punish modern-day "sinners". But who is responsible and why?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When wealthy farmer Martin Strickland is covered in truffle oil and mauled to death by a wild boar, the investigation leads to restaurant Wyvern House and its tyrannical celebrity chef Ruth Cameron. Secrets from the past surface and the killer strikes again - but the poison spreads wider than its intended target.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When a body is discovered in a reservoir dropped out of a plane, Barnaby and Nelson find the world of stunt pilots and military heroes hides many dark secrets. Are campaigners against the local airfield behind Bernard King's murder or does it link back to a tragic story from World War Two?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When the boss of Calder's Biscuit Company is murdered in Copenhagen, Barnaby and Nelson join forces with two female Danish detectives, the abrasive and astute Poulsen and the charming and cool Degn. They discover Eric Calder had more linking him to Copenhagen than just his famous Golden Clusters.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The closing of what was once a very popular public garden in Midsomer Deverell sparks a series of murders that have Inspector Barnaby and Sgt. Troy stumped.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Following the funeral of local hotelier Karl Wainwright, his hotel's manager and a well liked Punch and Judy performer, Gregory Chambers, disappears unusually in yet another picturesque Midsomer village. Most people dismiss his disappearance completely but when he doesn't turn up, a search is conducted and a severed hand, confirmed to be Gregory's, turns up in the woods. Further deaths and a mushroom poisoning occur surrounding the beneficiaries of Karl Wainwright's will. All is not as it seems.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A man's naked body found under mysterious circumstances, within a crop circle on Sir Harry Chatwyn's wheat field, leads police to investigating how he wound up in the field after being electrocuted. While the nearby village of Midsomer Parva is abuzz with UFO mania, Barnaby is unconvinced by a local ufologist that the man's death was the result of alien activity, as he uncovers rivalries, theft and hatred during his investigations, soon after a well known burglar is found dead in another crop circle with identical injuries.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Returning home one night, in a drunken state, the local doctor of Newton Magna calls in the police after he had accidentally hit a man, yet when Barnaby and Troy arrive, the injured man is nowhere to be found. As they investigate the mystery, Barnaby encounters an old adversary who is working to help renovate the village and whose daughter is getting married to a local boy. Matters soon become complicated, when the body of the best man's father is found in a well that was being renovated, whom the detectives soon discover had disappeared on the day he was planning to run away with a local farmer's wife.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Dave Cutler, Goodman's Land's amorous postman, is found almost decapitated near the common early one morning. Newspaper girl Holly Reid (Kate Maberly) tells Barnaby that she heard music playing faintly nearby. Barnaby and Troy are aided in their investigations by local WPC Jay Nash (Gillian Kearney).

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The double murder of eccentric widow, Isobel Hewitt, and adulterous doctor, Duncan Goff, lead Barnaby and Troy into finding out more about their personal and private lives in the village of Malham Bridge. While Troy suspects an antique dealer that Isobel befriended is the culprit, Barnaby is not convinced, believing anyone the victims knew when they were alive could have been the murderer, from the doctor's wife to the local owner of a restaurant. Even Isobel's close family and members of a local fly fishing group are suspects as they investigate all possible angles.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When Martin Wroath is found dead in his home in Midsomer Worthy, Barnaby is unconvinced that he committed suicide with his own shotgun in an unnecessarily complex fashion. When a second murder occurs on an assault course at a local cottage hospital, in which Wroath was a patient, the detective suspects a link between the two murders, and soon finds a wealth of hatred, jealously and lies, before discovering that rope in the village is mysteriously disappearing.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Joyce is taking part in an open-air art class, being held on the village green of Midsomer Florey, when she discovers the body of an elderly fellow student, Ruth Fairfax, concealed beneath some undergrowth shortly after a session. Just as Barnaby begins to learn that Ruth was not all she seemed to be, officers of the NIS pull him off the case. While Troy is allowed to assist them, Barnaby is left handling a local operation into a spate of thefts, yet he decides to continue his investigations in secret. In doing so, he soon turns up armed robbery, unaccounted stolen money, former criminals, and secret liaisons, before discovering that the NIS investigation is not being as thorough as it should be.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: At his family home in Upper Warden, arrogant actor Larry Smith is killed, when a summer house he walks in to as part of a promotion for the sequel to his hit film, The House of Satan, is suddenly destroyed in an explosion. His family quickly fling accusations for his murder directly at the residents of rival village, Lower Warden, leading Barnaby and Troy to determine if this is the case, especially when Larry's director, another member of the family, is electrocuted while using an exercise bike. It's not long before secrets, affairs and blackmail begin to surface from within the two villages.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny is commissioned to custom paint a brand new pick-up for a charity auction for the local YMCA.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Get revved up when Danny spots a killer 1967 Pontiac GTO at one of the biggest car shows in Vegas.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny has wanted a Plymouth Roadrunner ever since a couple of car nuts pulled him over a few years ago, and bought his Sebring on the spot.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny and the Count's Kustoms crew rally together to help Shannon restore his father's long lost chopper. Meanwhile, Danny does a do-over on his customized 1990 Chevy Suburban.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny discovers the rarest Cadillac collection he's ever seen. Later, Horny Mike has 30 days to move his big ugly bus.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: When the World Series of Poker guys want a Count's Kustoms chopper as the ultimate online giveaway, Danny is determined to make it something special.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Former Guns & Roses guitarist DJ Ashba arrives at Count's Kustoms in a 2004 Lamborghini Murcielago that he wants turned into the ultimate "mancar".

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny looks at some of the most famous clients to walk through the doors at Count's Kustoms; Elvira, who needs a facelift for her infamous Macabre Mobile; Chumlee and the Lincoln Continental he wants to flip in true "Pawn Stars" fashion.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny wants to fix up and flip a 1978 Lincoln Continental Town Car. That is, if he can bring himself to let it go. Then, the crew transforms a 1954 Oldsmobile Rocket 88.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny is visited by legendary Mistress of the Dark, Elvira, whose famous Thunderbird is in need of some mechanical magic.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny and Horny Mike get too close for comfort when they convince a Model-T Hot Rod owner to let them take it for a spin. Later, a Soap Box race car brings out the inner child in Roli and Mike.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Rock legend Alice Cooper drops by the shop to hang with fellow Detroit rocker Danny, and he leaves his prized '63 Studebaker Avanti behind to get the Count's special treatment.
